full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 769 Filed 08/10/22 Page 12 of 19 3103 LCLVMAXT
1 THE COURT: Mr. Everdell.
2 MR. EVERDELL: Your Honor, I think --
3 THE COURT: Clearly the substantive answer is yes.
4 MR. EVERDELL: Well, I think, as we've discussed in the briefing and in the limiting instruction, the answer is a little more complicated than --
5
6
7 THE COURT: Well, your view is more complicated. You took a different view. I have ruled differently. And so I think based -- I think it's clear based on my rulings the answer to the question is yes.
8
9
10
11 MR. EVERDELL: I think what we should do is give the jury the same limiting instruction as to her testimony that you gave before her testimony; because I think that actually gives the jury exactly what they can consider and not consider her testimony for.
12
13
14
15
16 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, the limiting instruction was targeted at Counts Two and Four, the substantive counts, to make clear that Annie's testimony was not the basis of a substantive count. I don't think it's necessary for Counts One and Three. I think the answer is clearly yes, made all the more so by the fact that Annie's testimony or a part of it is referenced as an overt act in the indictment in the instructions. I think the simplest answer and the correct answer is yes.
17
18
19
20
21
22
23
24
25 MR. EVERDELL: I don't think it's correct at all that SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00017290
